本課程為全英語授課，本學期規劃之課程中僅有一場校外講者會以中文進行分享，其餘授課、討論、分享與報告都將以英語為主要語言。

**Course Description**

This course aims at preparing students to do continuing professional development (CPD) as well as stimulating deeper understanding of the professionalism of being a teacher. The importance of CPD in contemporary educational practices is acknowledged globally. In order to equip students with abilities to achieve better in this fast-changing world, education professionals can no longer teach knowledge but have to infuse high order thinking skills such as critical thinking and systems thinking in their teaching. Education Professionals such as teachers, and school leaders are required to be life-long learners so that they can improve the quality of their teaching practices, engage students in various learning activities and demonstrate that they continuingly expand their capacity as an individual and a professional.

**Learning Objectives**

There are three main components of this course in the 18 weeks: 1. Understanding the importance of professionalism and CPD 2. Exploring various approaches to CPD, and 3. Experiencing and reflecting good practices of CPD in schools. The detailed learning objectives are as follow:

**Course Structure**

This course is practical and student-centered. To understand the value and approaches to CPD, the best way is through hands-on experience. Therefore, the course is designed on a mixture of lectures and hands-on tasks. In the first five weeks, students will be introduced to the basics of CPD including its importance, approaches and status quo of CPD in Taiwanese context. Four to five invited speakers from local secondary schools as well as from IB schools in Taipei are going to share their experience related to professional learning community and CPD in week 6. From week 7 to week 11, students in group of 5 to 6 are going to do hands-on task that is to observe how teachers practice CPD in schools. Each group needs to choose at least one professional learning community as their case study. (For IB students, they need to have two CPD cases from different types of school: one is local Taiwanese secondary school and the other must be an IB school) From week 12 to week 14, it is for individual group tutorial and data analysis. Each group prepare their case(s) and meet up with the instructor to discuss the content. Week 15 to week 17, each group needs to present their cases and lead the discussion. The finalized case(s) report is due on week 18.
